Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice or heavy chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; exterior: painted decoration consisting of sphinx (part of wing, body and legs remaining with added red patches on wing, body and hind legs) to left; rosettes as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: The thickness of the sherd suggests that it may have come from a heavy chalice
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 257, no. 462, pl. 63)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1338) (phase 2)
